title: Exact uploaded logo usage + best-practice SEO across all pages (on-page + technical)

requirements.summary: Use the uploaded logo asset as the single source of truth for header/footer branding and favicon references, with no visual modifications or alternate marks.
acceptanceCriteria: The header and footer render the same uploaded logo image file (single source of truth), and it is not altered via CSS filters or alternate assets.
The favicon links in frontend/index.html reference the full uploaded logo favicon assets and load correctly in modern browsers.
No other logo variants are introduced (no monochrome/flat versions) unless they are byte-identical conversions required for favicon sizing.

file_operations.description: Ensure the header/footer logo always uses the exact uploaded asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/marco-marketing-logo-uploaded.dim_512x512.png with no CSS filters, recolors, or alternate sources.

Update structured data logo/image references to use the same uploaded logo asset (frontend/public/assets/generated/marco-marketing-logo-uploaded.dim_512x512.png) instead of any alternate logo file to prevent introducing non-identical logo variants.

Verify favicon/apple-touch-icon links reference the generated favicon assets converted from the uploaded logo: frontend/public/assets/generated/marco-marketing-favicon.dim_256x256.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/marco-marketing-favicon.dim_32x32.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/marco-marketing-favicon.dim_16x16.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/marco-marketing-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png.

requirements.summary: Enforce strict on-page SEO across all pages: keyword-first titles (<60 chars), keyword-containing descriptions (<160 chars), and correct semantic heading hierarchy with a single H1 per page.
acceptanceCriteria: Every route sets a unique meta title and meta description that meet the length and keyword-placement constraints (<60 title chars; <160 description chars; primary keyword included; keyword at start of title).

Home page continues to target primary keyword "SEO Agency" with supporting keyword "USA" in title, H1, and intro copy; Logo Design Services page continues to target primary keyword "Logo Design Services" with supporting keyword "USA" similarly.
Each page has exactly one H1 and uses headings semantically (H2 sections under H1; H3 subsections under H2; no heading levels used only for visual sizing).

file_operations.description: Add centralized enforcement for per-route meta title/description constraints (title starts with provided primary keyword intent, <60 chars; description includes keyword intent, <160 chars) by normalizing/trimming values deterministically and preventing stale values on navigation.
Adjust SEO title/description values to comply with strict length constraints while keeping primary keyword "SEO Agency" at the start and including supporting keyword "USA" in title/H1/intro copy.
Adjust SEO title/description values to comply with strict length constraints and ensure title begins with the page’s primary keyword intent; verify a single H1 and consistent H2+ hierarchy.
Adjust SEO title/description values to comply with strict length constraints and ensure title begins with the page’s primary keyword intent; verify a single H1 and consistent H2+ hierarchy.

Adjust SEO title/description values to comply with strict length constraints while keeping primary keyword "Logo Design Services" at the start and including supporting keyword "USA" in title/H1/intro copy; verify a single H1 and consistent H2+ hierarchy.
Adjust SEO title/description values to comply with strict length constraints and ensure title begins with the page’s primary keyword intent; verify a single H1 and consistent H2+ hierarchy.
Update SEO title/description generation to comply with strict length constraints while ensuring the title starts with the post’s primary keyword intent (the post title) and avoids overly long titles.
Add/ensure a single, clear H1 exists in the authenticated editor view and apply strict SEO meta rules (and later noindex handling via the SEO hook) without adding new routes.
Adjust SEO title/description values to comply with strict length constraints and ensure title begins with the page’s primary keyword intent; verify a single H1 and consistent H2+ hierarchy.
Add/ensure a single, clear H1 exists in the authenticated profile view and apply strict SEO meta rules (and later noindex handling via the SEO hook).

requirements.summary: Add static technical SEO assets for crawling/indexing by serving robots.txt and sitemap.xml from the frontend public assets.
acceptanceCriteria: /robots.txt is accessible and includes a Sitemap directive pointing to /sitemap.xml.
/sitemap.xml is accessible, valid XML, and includes canonical URLs for all public pages (at minimum: /, /services, /services/seo, /services/logo-design, /blog, /about).
Routes that should not be indexed (e.g., authenticated/editor utility pages if applicable) are excluded from sitemap and disallowed in robots.txt as appropriate.

file_operations.description: Create a static robots.txt that allows public pages, disallows utility/authenticated routes (e.g., /profile, /blog/editor), and includes a Sitemap directive pointing to /sitemap.xml.

Create a static sitemap.xml listing canonical URLs for all public, indexable routes (at minimum: /, /services, /services/seo, /services/logo-design, /blog, /about) and exclude non-indexable utility routes such as blog editor pages and profile.

requirements.summary: Harden per-route SEO metadata so canonical/OG/Twitter tags and JSON-LD update reliably without duplicates or stale data during client-side navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating between routes updates document.title, meta description, canonical, OG, and Twitter tags to match the current page (no duplicates and no stale values from prior pages).
JSON-LD changes with the current route and does not retain previous page schema content after navigation.
All pages continue to include appropriate structured data (site-wide Organization/WebSite; BlogPosting on blog post pages; FAQPage on the SEO Services page).

file_operations.description: Update the SEO hook to (1) set/update canonical, Open Graph, and Twitter tags per route, (2) remove tags that are no longer applicable when navigating (prevent stale/duplicated tags), and (3) inject JSON-LD deterministically and remove it when absent (no stale schema between routes).

Ensure structured data helpers support the required schemas consistently: site-wide Organization/WebSite across pages, BlogPosting for blog posts, and FAQPage on the SEO Services page; also align logo/image references to the uploaded logo asset.
Ensure Services page supplies stable canonical + structured data inputs (Organization/WebSite) to the hardened SEO hook so tags and JSON-LD reflect the current route on navigation.
Ensure Blog index supplies stable canonical + structured data inputs (Organization/WebSite) to the hardened SEO hook so tags and JSON-LD reflect the current route on navigation.
Ensure Blog post page provides canonical + BlogPosting JSON-LD inputs deterministically per slug so the hardened SEO hook updates tags and schema without carrying over prior post metadata.
Ensure SEO Services page provides canonical + combined Organization/WebSite + FAQPage JSON-LD deterministically so the hardened SEO hook updates tags and schema correctly across navigation.
Ensure Home page provides canonical + combined Organization/WebSite JSON-LD deterministically so the hardened SEO hook updates tags and schema correctly across navigation.
Ensure About page provides canonical + Organization/WebSite JSON-LD deterministically so the hardened SEO hook updates tags and schema correctly across navigation.
